document.docAuthor: Soto, Eduardo M. & Ramírez, Martín J.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Philisca Simon (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Amaurobioidinae) 3443

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philisca ornata Berland, 1924: 435
(male and female syntypes , from the Juan Fernandez Islands, Más a Tierra, 28.XII.1916 , K. Bäckström, in NRS, S.P.E. 188, and male paratype from Más a Tierra, 1917, Bäckström [labeled “cotype”], in MHNP, not reexamined).
Ramírez, 2003: 181
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: It resembles other species of the
ornata
group by the modified male chelicerae and the epigyne with smooth, heart shaped median field close to the epigastric furrow ( Figs 34f , 12b, c ). It can be distinguished having a large yellow body ( Fig. 1d , 13a ) and a very long male palpal tibia ( Fig. 34f ; Ramírez 2003 : fig. 98c).
Description: Male and female described in Ramírez (2003) .
Distribution: Known only from the Juan Fernandez Archipelago, Robinson Crusoe Island, Chile .
